data.title: [ci skip]Avoid setting responseType in synchronous xhr
All effects will be canceled if play many effects at the same time and turn to background on iOS
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.6
- devices test on: iPhone5s(10.2.1)   iPhone 6S(10.3.3)
- Xcode version: 8.3

1. play many effects at the same time
2. click HOME to make app into background
3. make app to foreground
4. all effects will lost even invoke codes to resume effects

Use `SimpleAudioEngine`.

data.title: [ci skip] update web ref
How to keep listener attached to node enabled
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: git

As I know keeping node priority listener enabled is impossible righ now. But I want to keep listener enabled (update text lablels on changing language), so I've got some suggestions. Using fixed priority is very bad idea: it is a library, and I should remove listener with node. But a small question at first: will be child listeners called if its node is disabled? I'll share some ideas if answer is "yes", in other case it should be hard to implenent it.

data.title: fix android editor box use 'setSelection' when the beyond the border error
data.body:
@dumganhar say:
It's probably editBox.setText sets a string longer than its max value.
And setText internally does a clip operation.
Therefore, the string returned by editBox.getText() may shorter than text.length().

data.title: undefined reference to 'stderr'
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cocos creator v1.6.1
- devices test on: Samsung SHV-E330L (Android 5.0.1, API 21)
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 15.2.4203891
   - Xcode version: not using
   - VS version: VS 2015 professional 14.0.25431.01 Update 3
   - browser type and version: Google Chrome 61.0.3163.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When I did set API level to 23 and compile native to android studio, it succeed but if I run it on device api 21 then I got error "cannot locate symbol stderr referenced by libcocos2djs.so".
2. So I changed API level to 21 and retry compile at cocos creator. But it was failed with error "undefined undefined reference to 'stderr'".

Please help

data.title: Please update spine runtimes to latest version
data.body:
After updating Spine to the latest version I'm no longer able to open skeletons. 

- cocos2d-x version: 3.15 from github (27.09.2017)
- devices test on: iPad 2
- developing environments
   - NDK version: N/A
   - Xcode version: 9.0
   - VS version: N/A
   - browser type and version: N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Acquire the latest Spine and save the model as binary (.skel extension).
2. call SkeletonAnimation::createWithBinaryFile

it crashes (EXC_BAD_ACCESS) on this line:
`slotData->attachmentName = readString(input);`

in SkeletonBinary.c.

https://imgur.com/a/7CwOR

data.title: The first character is disappeared at the head of a new line in UIRichTxt
data.body:
In some cases， the first character is disappeared at the head of a new line in UIRichTxt.

- cocos2d-x version:3.15
- devices test on:Windows7 64
- developing environments
   - NDK version:NA
   - Xcode version:NA
   - VS version:Visual Studio Community 2013
   - browser type and version:NA

Steps to Reproduce:

1. push two RichElementText， "캐릭터헤라클래스,로키,나폴레옹“，”획득시 물리공격+20%", into a RichText, and adjust the width of the richText to make "20%" in a new line.
2. We will see the following
"캐릭터헤라클래스,로키,나폴레옹획득시 물리공격+
0%"
Note that “2” is disappeared.

By checking the code，I found a problem here:
//UIRichText.cpp
//RichText::handleTextRenderer
int rightStart = leftLength;
if (std::isspace(text[rightStart], std::locale()))
            rightStart++;

I think it should be written like this:
if (std::isspace(text[leftWords.length()], std::locale()))
            rightStart++;

In this case, rightStart is the num of character in UTF8(), which is 9, and leftWords.length() is 23.

data.title: Fix performance problems with RenderTexture on Non-iOS devices
data.body: Fix #18321 : performance problems with RenderTexture on Android

data.title: Performance issues with RenderTexture on non-iOS devices (Android, Windows)
data.body:
An application using RenderTexture, runs smoothly on iOS - rendering of 34 sprites takes ca. 200ms. The same operation takes 3420ms on Android.

A similar problem was observed on Windows Phone [http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/solved-rendertexture-is-very-slow-on-3-7-versions/28055](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/solved-rendertexture-is-very-slow-on-3-7-versions/28055), where Yusel described an workaround : deactivation of the group render command in RenderTexture.

The group command was introduced in 3.7 - as an implementation of "Group command" from [Roadmap of Render Pipeline](http://www.cocos2d-x.org/wiki/Cocos2d_v30_renderer_pipeline_roadmap), which speed up a rendering performance.

I implemented Yusels workaround - and saw my application needs just 200 ms on Android, exactly as on iOS. I was interesting in finding out, where is the problem and so Yusels workaround was a base for my problem analyses, which discovered the following facts:
1. rendering of "X" sprites on RenderTexture will lead to inserting of "Y" commands into one render queue assigned to the group - which is a goal of group command. Those "Y" commands render all "X" objects.
2. the group command itself is added "X" times into render queue - which is a problem, it should be added just once
3. result: rendering of RenderTexture writes "X"*"Y" times into GPU instead of just "Y" times
4. iOS has apparently kind of "smart filter" over the GPU, which filters/ignores exactly same openGL operations, Android and Windows phone does not have it and therefore the rendering is very slow.

This problem might occur in all classes using Group Command for rendering:
CCClippingNode.cpp
CCNodeGrid.cpp
CCRenderTexture.cpp
UILayout.cpp.cpp
(I just searched for "addCommand(&_groupCommand")

Due to fact, that I am using just RenderTexture, I am not sure.

SOLUTION:
Make sure group render command will be added just one time and not "X" times for "X" sprites.

I've implemented a workaround, which is added into this case as a possible solution. I wrote it in general way and therefore I needed a function from Render as well.

Maybe a better/smarter solution exists...

CONCLUSION:
Any application using RenderTexture on a non iOS operational system is lagging. I believe a quick fix should be introduced to avoid bugs with title "Android performance issue".

data.title: Scene cameras
Xcode 9 warning - possible misuse of comma operator here
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest github source (25.09.2017)
- devices test on: N/A
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version: 9.0
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any cocos2d-x project in Xcode 9.0.
2. I'm getting the following warning in CCAnimationCurce.inl file:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/3d/CCAnimationCurve.inl

https://imgur.com/a/Hd6cQ

in line 49:

`dst[0] = quat.x, dst[1] = quat.y, dst[2] = quat.z, dst[3] = quat.w;`

> Possible misuse of comma operator here.

Shouldn't it be a semicolon?

data.title: Fix accelerometer on Android on reverse landscape/portrait.
data.body:
The accelerometer should adjust when the screen is on reverse landscape or reverse portrait (upside down). This is already done on iOS:

https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/b633260020cba97a4160eb2a6f81b270b424657b/cocos/platform/ios/CCDevice-ios.mm#L250-L266

This PR makes the accelerometer behave in the same way on Android too.

cnode zorder advice
data.body:
Node, zorder design, I personally think it does not need to be so complicated.
1. the join order have the draw order with the same zorder， we can supply the interface to change join order to change draw order， it is no need to set sort dirty。
2.also to support the setting of zorder to reorder
